A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I've seen all the Star Wars movies\, and I must confess i'm a little STAR WORN-OUT.  Is it wrong to suggest now 'seen one SW movie and you've seen them all'?  Probably wrong.  Sure the scenery was nice and the space shots and space-craft\, space ships\, etc.\, are always beautiful and interesting.  Fine.  What it it with these Jedi anyway?  They have God-like powers.  They can levitate many huge heavy boulders at one time with their minds.  They can apparently get blown to smithereens yet emerge/return just fine.  And\, of course\, there's that tired old \"Let the FARCE be with you.\"  Lame 'spirituality'\, especially for those who otherwise won't admit of anything so SuperNatural as God.  And how convenient it is that no one owes any 'moral obligations' to a 'Force'. A 'Force' has no Intellect\, Mind\, Will\, or Emotion.  Luke Skywalker taught the new young girl Jedi (Ray?) that the way to control or manipulate the 'Force' was to 'reach out with your 'feelings'\"
